alert.note: Alert for Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Western Addison; Western Chittenden (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 3:17PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Addison and central Chittenden Counties through 345 PM EDT... At 317 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hinesburg, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Essex Junction, South Burlington, Burlington International Airport, Burlington, Hinesburg, St. George, Winooski, Monkton Ridge, Essex, Monkton, Starksboro, Colchester, Essex Junction Village, Williston, Richmond, Jericho Village, Huntington, Buels Gore, Westford and Shelburne. This includes Interstate 89 between mile markers 78 and 96. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central and northwestern Vermont.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Addison; Eastern Chittenden; Western Addison; Western Chittenden
